content: Singaporean businessman and politician **Gabriel Lam Yen Li**[a] (born 1982) is a Singaporean businessman and politician. He was elected into the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) on 4 May 2025. Lam represents the Canberra division in [Sembawang Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Sembawang_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Career Gabriel Lam is the chief operating officer of moving company Shalom International Movers. Lam first entered politics in the [2025 general election](/wiki/2025_Singaporean_general_election) as part of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)'s [Sembawang GRC](/wiki/Sembawang_Group_Representation_Constituency) team led by Health Minister [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung) replacing [Lim Wee Kiak](/wiki/Lim_Wee_Kiak). His team faced a three-cornered fight against the [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party) and [National Solidarity Party](/wiki/National_Solidarity_Party_(Singapore)). He was elected into the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) on 3 May 2025 with 67.75% of the vote against the SDP's 29.93% and NSP's 2.32%. ## Personal life Lam is married and has three children ## Notes [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)Preceded by[Vikram Nair](/wiki/Vikram_Nair) [Lim Wee Kiak](/wiki/Lim_Wee_Kiak) [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung) [Mariam Jaafar](/wiki/Mariam_Jaafar) [Poh Li San](/wiki/Poh_Li_San) **Member of Parliament for [Sembawang GRC](/wiki/Sembawang_GRC)** 2025â€“present Served alongside: **(2025-present): [Vikram Nair](/wiki/Vikram_Nair), [Ng Shi Xuan](/wiki/Ng_Shi_Xuan), [Mariam Jaafar](/wiki/Mariam_Jaafar), [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung)****Incumbent** This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
title: Gabriel Lam (Singaporean politician)
